page.title: 19RELIGION
page.content: which came to Clydebank in May 1985. In school Catholics are taught {Religious Studies.}This is the study of many different religions and beliefs.In Protestant schools this is called{Religious Education.}Catholics are also taught{R.E.}but they concentrate on their own religion.The R.E.teachers in Catholic schools don't need any qualifications but they must believe in the Catholic Church.R.E. teachers in Protestant schools do need qualifications.Some schools have a club,{Scripture Union},who arrange summer camps.At these camps the children take part in sporting activities for most of the day but also have Bible Classes.
